philosophy.title: The First Charter of
philosophy.quote: I gathered all their peoples and returned them to their homes. I restored their sanctuaries and let them worship their gods.
philosophy.legacyP1: In 539 BCE, when Cyrus conquered Babylon, he did something unprecedented. Rather than enslave or oppress, he freed captive peoples—including the Jews, whom he allowed to return to Jerusalem and rebuild their temple.
philosophy.legacyP2: The Cyrus Cylinder, now housed in the British Museum, is recognized by the United Nations as the world's first charter of human rights. It proclaimed religious freedom, abolished slavery, and established the dignity of all peoples.
philosophy.blockchainP1: We're a radical social experiment in global community building and decentralized governance. Open source, open governance—this is the future we're building together.
philosophy.blockchainP2: Governance designed to be open, verifiable, and accountable. Submit proposals. Debate publicly. Vote on budgets. Track outcomes onchain. No single authority controls this—the community does.
philosophy.missionP1: The Cyrus the Great Coin was created as a symbol of urgency, unity, and national revival.
philosophy.missionP2: Rooted in the legacy of Cyrus the Great, its mission is to support the Iranian people in their struggle for freedom after decades of oppression. It seeks to empower the revolution, aid a transition toward Reza Pahlavi and a stable interim government, and lay the foundations for a democratic, prosperous Iran.
philosophy.missionP3: Beyond the fight, it embodies a long-term commitment to rebuilding a strong and proud nation.
philosophy.foundedBy: Founded by Cyrus Pahlavi and the Cyrus Foundation (cyrus.ngo)
philosophy.empoweringDesc: Funding projects in education, entrepreneurship, and opportunity—putting people first. Creating pathways for the next generation to thrive.
philosophy.revivingDesc: Financing a landmark television series, Cyrus the Great, bringing Persian heritage to global audiences. Preserving and celebrating 2,500 years of civilization.
philosophy.prosperityDesc: Creating a cycle where profits flow back to the people through the DAO treasury. Community-controlled funds for humanitarian and cultural initiatives.
philosophy.tagline: Cyrus the Great Coin: The people's voice on the blockchain

empire.title: The First
empire.description: The Achaemenid Empire established by Cyrus the Great was not just the largest empire of the ancient world—it was the first to embrace religious tolerance, cultural diversity, and human rights as governing principles.
empire.mapAlt: Ancient Persia - Achaemenid Empire map showing territories from the Black Sea to the Persian Gulf
empire.stat1Desc: The first Persian Empire, founded by Cyrus the Great, lasted over 200 years and became the largest empire the ancient world had ever seen.
empire.stat2Desc: At its peak under Darius I, the Achaemenid Empire spanned from Egypt and Libya in the west to the Indus River in the east—44% of the world's population.
empire.stat3Desc: Cyrus peacefully entered Babylon and freed the Jewish people from captivity, allowing them to return home and rebuild their temple in Jerusalem.
empire.stat4Desc: The empire was divided into provinces, each with local autonomy—a revolutionary form of governance that respected diverse cultures and religions.

diaspora.title: The Persian
diaspora.description: An estimated 4-5 million Iranians live outside of Iran, forming one of the world's most accomplished diaspora communities. From Silicon Valley to Hollywood, from academia to medicine, Iranians contribute to societies worldwide.
diaspora.region1Note: Largest diaspora community, concentrated in Los Angeles ('Tehrangeles'), New York, and Washington D.C.
diaspora.region2Note: Significant communities in Germany, United Kingdom, France, Sweden, and the Netherlands.
diaspora.region3Note: Major communities in Toronto and Vancouver, with strong cultural institutions.
diaspora.region4Note: Communities in UAE, Turkey, and other regional countries.
diaspora.region5Note: Growing community primarily in Sydney and Melbourne.

diaspora.unityDescription: Whether you're in Los Angeles, London, or Tehran—the Cyrus DAO empowers every token holder to vote on initiatives that preserve Persian heritage, support humanitarian causes, and spread Cyrus's message of tolerance.

principles.title: Values That
principles.description: Derived directly from the Cyrus Cylinder, these principles guide every decision we make as an organization.
principles.p1Desc: Cyrus freed the Jewish people from Babylonian captivity and funded the rebuilding of their temple. He permitted all peoples to worship freely. We champion this principle—every faith deserves respect and protection.
principles.p2Desc: The Cyrus Cylinder explicitly abolished slavery, recognizing every person's inherent worth. Today, we extend this principle through humanitarian aid—food, water, shelter, and education for all who need it.
principles.p3Desc: Cyrus established laws that applied equally to nobles and servants alike. Our governance follows this model—every CYRUS token holder has an equal voice, and every decision is transparently recorded.
principles.p4Desc: Rather than erasing conquered cultures, Cyrus celebrated diversity as strength. We preserve Persian heritage—art, philosophy, language—while supporting the traditions of all peoples we serve.

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about CYRUS, the auction, and the Cyrus DAO.
faq.a1: CYRUS is the official token of the PARS community, honoring the legacy of Cyrus the Great (Kourosh-e Bozorg). It unifies the global Persian diaspora—estimated at 8 million people worldwide—around shared heritage and the timeless principles of freedom, tolerance, and human dignity. Built on Base (Ethereum L2) with a fixed supply of 1 billion tokens.
faq.q2: How do I get CYRUS tokens?
faq.a2: CYRUS tokens are sold through a quadratic bonding curve. The price starts at $0.01 and rises to $1.00 as more tokens are sold—early buyers get up to 100× more tokens for the same amount! To participate, you'll need USDT on Base blockchain and a compatible wallet like Coinbase Wallet or MetaMask.
faq.a3: A bonding curve is a mathematical formula that determines token price based on supply. CYRUS uses a quadratic curve where price increases faster as more tokens are sold. This rewards early supporters while ensuring fair access for everyone. The price starts at $0.01 per token and ends at $1.00 (100× range).
faq.a4: CYRUS is exclusively available on Base—an Ethereum Layer 2 blockchain built by Coinbase. Base offers low transaction fees, fast confirmations, and the security of Ethereum. You'll need ETH on Base for gas fees and USDT to purchase CYRUS tokens.
faq.a5: 1 billion CYRUS tokens are distributed as: 50% to the DAO Treasury for community initiatives, 10% for initial Liquidity Pool on Base DEX, and 40% through the public sale via bonding curve. No team allocation. No VC rounds. No pre-sale. Everyone starts equal.
faq.a6: The CYRUS DAO is the decentralized governance body where token holders direct treasury funds. One token equals one vote. The DAO funds Persian language schools, cultural centers, heritage preservation, humanitarian initiatives, and community programs. All votes are recorded on-chain at cyrus.vote.
faq.a7: CYRUS was created by the PARS community and the Cyrus Foundation (cyrus.ngo). It is a community initiative by members of the Persian diaspora, dedicated to promoting the values of Cyrus the Great—religious freedom, human dignity, and cultural tolerance.
faq.a8: No. CYRUS is a community token for coordination and governance, not a security or investment. There is NO expectation of financial gain or profit. Token value may go to zero. Only participate with funds you can afford to lose completely. Always do your own research.
faq.q9: How do I buy with USDT?
faq.a9: First, ensure you have USDT on Base blockchain. Connect your wallet, enter the amount of USDT you want to spend, and click 'Buy CYRUS'. You'll first approve USDT spending, then confirm the purchase. The bonding curve will calculate how many tokens you receive based on the current price.
faq.a10: After the bonding curve completes, CYRUS will be tradeable on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) on Base blockchain. The 10% LP Reserve is used to seed initial liquidity. Always verify you're using the official contract address before trading.
faq.q11: How can I participate in governance?
faq.a11: Holding CYRUS tokens gives you voting rights in the DAO. Visit cyrus.vote to view active proposals, discuss initiatives, and cast your votes. Proposals require 100,000+ CYRUS to submit, with quorum requirements from 5-20% depending on proposal type. All governance is transparent and on-chain.
